messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand what I need to do for my health. The problems that I have had in the process usually have been because the doctors don't have enough time for me or don't care explain anything because they think their patients are too dumb to understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

As to doctors in general, I don't trust them completely because they will often do what is best for them rather than what is best for the patient. For instance, they may not prescribe a patient with chronic pain the right medication because they don't want to prescribe certain drugs.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Usually I am in doctorÃ¢ÂÂs office because itÃ¢ÂÂs a last resort and I canÃ¢ÂÂt fix whatever is happening to me so by that point I am pretty worried about what is happening to my body and what may happen in the future.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I noticed my Father was coughing a lot and wheezing. He seemed to be extra weak as well. I thought something serious was happening to him and he thought that he had the a cold. I convinced him to let me bring him to the ER and he was diagnosed with heart failure and they had to put a stint in one of his arteries.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have the capability to do all of the above.  The problem comes in understanding the always changing process, being told one thing by one nurse/doctor and being told something else by another.  Sometimes the information presented to read and understand at times reads like its meant for professiols in the field, not the non-medical educated.  I do a lot of asking when big medical words are used "what does that mean".  Sometimes I feel like I'm just supposed to understand and process what they want me to!  My health is good enough and I'm educated enough to understand most, but people like my mom have no clue and just go on whatever doctors want to do and trust.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

If I did not trust my physician I would change and find one that I would.  I trust my physician currently as I watch how he lives his life outside of the medical field.  Church, community, family.  I judge their ethics away from work to get a feel and add it to how Im treated and the discussions at the office.  Its usually going to see other doctors (any little thing you always have to go see somebody else or 2 or 3) where I have my problems with trust, don't have many to choose from so have to use doctors that are available.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The hope that nothing bad comes out of the exam.  I go to an exam if I think something might need to be checked, or for bloodwork ect.  Its always a worry that something will maybe be wrong.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Getting preventive care and treatment.  Understanding the blood work data, the colonoscopy and all related.  To be able to know what I needed to improve on and to watch.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel like sometimes it is hard to understand the information and services about health care. I do think I can figure it out though. There are many resources available to help with things like that these days.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
For the most part, I think doctors are trustworthy. However, they are very busy and see a lot of patients, so they could make mistakes, just like everyone else.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Wondering what the outcome of my exam would be. Imagining if there is something wrong and what needs to happen next.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I've had a baby, and my wife has been in and out of the hospital the past 2 years for a few surgeries. My sister is also a nurse, and has talked with me about a lot of medical and health issues.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I do have the intelligence to make good choices. In regards to my health I feel that have full capability to do so. I have very good reading comprehension skills and a good understanding of how ailments affect the body.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor because I know of their certifications and background. I have known them for a long time as well with no issues. Every time they helped me their advice has worked well.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The initial first visit for an issue I am having bothers me most. Without any knowledge from them yet I get very anxious. When they tell me the diagnosis I get worried.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was having blisters showing up on my skin one day. Even after washing they would not go away. I knew that it was probably a staph infection. I decided to go to a doctor about it and they didn't have to give an explanation because of my familiarity with the diagnosis.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I believe that although the system can be complicated, I am capable of making appropriate health decisions. I can ask for clarification and help with forms and acquire more information about topics and conditions being discussed.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I find my doctor to be very trustworthy. He is open and honest with me and make things easy to understand.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When I have something wrong and the doctor takes a long time to figure out what it is. Though I suppose the worst is worrying about the cost of the procedure.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was able to read the information about my prescription and figure out what the side effects actually meant. This helped me to decide if I should stay on the prescription or not.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You are quite active physically on a weekly basis. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I have a strong capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions. I am very confident in my research ability and the internet has reliable sources of information when you know where to look. Outside of the internet, I have access to health professionals that I can speak with or make appointments to meet if I have any concerns regarding my health or any health related decisions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I am neutral in trusting my primary care physician due to having a negative experience during my childhood where I was misdiagnosed multiple times and given wrong advice/information regarding my health. It got to the point where it was almost too late for me to survive because my parents were being told that their child only had a cold/fever. Outside of that experience, I normally do not put that much trust in a person regardless of it being their profession because some people only have their own interests in mind.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

When visiting the doctor's office I am always filled with anxiety and dread due to the environment always giving me that feeling since childhood. It probably roots back to a fear of needles and too much media, but it still affects me to this day. Today, it would instead be a fear of being diagnosed with some incurable disease or being told that I can no longer do the things I enjoy in life due to some pain or injuries. Outside of that, a routine doctor's visit is normally only filled with worry on the drive there. I usually leave feeling more ensured and happier than when I came in.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Most of my knowledge regarding health or medical issues is not from learning about them from doctors or reading about them on the internet, but rather it is from my previous experiences with them in my own life. When my friend was experiencing problems with frequent stomachaches and trips to the restroom, I told him that it sounded familiar to my own experience with the stomach flu. After being home-ridden for a week, he informs be that it was indeed the stomach flu and that my advice for him to take time off of school was important and necessary.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel very confident in my ability to communicate my symptoms and concerns to the doctor and then ask questions to clarify my understanding when they give a diagnosis.  I ask a LOT of questions and then I go home and do a little more research online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care person is a local Nurse Practitioner.  She is busy but never seems rushed while visiting with me about my concerns.  She listens and then asks questions to be sure she understands.  She explains the reason she will chose a certain treatment or why she's choosing to wait and see rather than treat right away.  I like that she doesn't talk down to me and treats me as though I am intelligent enough to understand.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
By the time I get to the doctor I've often thought of all the most terrible things my symptoms could be and though I know the worry is mostly unfounded, I am still anxious until I'm proven wrong.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband's cholesterol is high.  We talked to the doctor and then looked up information to see what target number we needed to get him to.  Then we researched on our own and followed information the doctor gave us to determine the changes we could make in our diet and exercise program to help bring his cholesterol down.  We were able to facilitate that change enough in 6 months to avoid needing to have him take medication.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think I have a good capacity to obtain, process and understand basic health information. I've never had a problem understanding my doctors or forms before. I do not think I need help with this.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I went to many doctors before I chose mine. She is very caring and very careful and attentive. I can tell she really cares and has my best interest at heart.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I'm usually worried that I will get bad news. I get anxious that they will tell me something is very wrong. Or if I don't know the doctor I get scared that they won't treat me right.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I had a bunch of fertility tests done. I had to go over everything from my cholesterol to vitamin deficiencies.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel like my doctors are very friendly and committed to making me feel comfortable as a patient. They have done a fantastic job and I would come to them for anything.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust him because he's been our family's primary care physician for a long time now. He is very helpful and courteous
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I get worried that I will have to get shots. I've had a phobia of them for a while
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My sister is training to be a nurse so I have some kind of history with medical knowledge

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I believe that I understand most of what my health providers tell me. When I'm uncertain, I search for more information. I have sought out a second medical opinion in the past.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

She never seems rushed with me, and she will always take the time to research an issue to make sure she's considered every possible solution. There was a time when I felt her treatment recommendation was too drastic, but she had no problem referring me to a specialist.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

With some health care providers in the past, I felt that they were too rushed and a little rough. During my first pregncy, I saw one doctor in the practice who gave me a quick, rough interl exam. Even my husband was cringing. When a doctor's bedside manner is impersol and they seem rushed for time, it usually makes me feel nervous, and I am much less likely to ask questions, lest I annoy the doctor.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A friend had been given antibiotic eye drops for her son's pink eye. She told me that in the past they had worked well, but this time they were not working as quickly. I asked if her son had recently had a cold, and she said yes. I told her that some pink eye is viral, in which case the eye drops will not help.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and rarely visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think I have all the means necessary to get my questions answered. I can google anything and I'm not afraid to ask a million questions if that's what it takes to understand the condition or issue.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor always answers all of my questions and has never steered my wrong. I'm never rushed and am always number one when I'm in the room with her.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing really makes me feel anxious or worried when I'm visiting the doctor. I know I'm there to get checked out and I'll take the next step as it comes.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My daughter fell off of a scooter and cut her leg open. There was a lot of blood pouring out onto the concrete. I knew that I needed to apply pressure to get the bleeding to stop and get her to immediate care as quickly as possible. She got 5 stitches in her knee.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel like I can through the internet by using things like google and going on different health websites.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I believe at the end of the day most doctors are all about the money and will put that before their patients. I am weary of them but I can trust some things they say.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I just feel like it always be bad news because of how I eat because I could do better in some aspects.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I can do math, I have family members that have medical issues and health problems, my sister is a doctor.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I have full cognitive ability to obtain and understand any medical info necessary to make an informed decision
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
His last name is Patel. And he is always in a hurry. Doesn't seem to listen to me. Maybe it's just me expecting to much.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Whether I have managed to improve my situation since the last visit. Or had it gotten worse. Also, has anything come up in my body..
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was able to determine that a medication prescribed for me was making me tired and feel very fatigued. The felt like the dosage was to high. So, I split the pill in half and started taking it like that. I continued to receive the benefits that the medication was prescribed for without the negative side effects

When making health decisions I make sure to read over what my doctor has said to me den I have some take a look at it also so I no that there is nothing I missed
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor understands my pain an what I need she talks to me for hours an dose her job right I believe in are 100%
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Noodle's I don't like the pain being told something is wrong in my body really make me worried are just having to visit my doctor
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Having to get a mammogram done it was something I never had before now oi have to go back for another test

You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think I am easily able to understand information given to me by health practitioners. I am rather reserved, though, and do sometimes have trouble asking extra questions while at an appointment.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I had a doctor I could trust but when we moved to a new state several years ago, I haven't found one I could trust here. I've found larger medical practices where the doctors are in a hurry and you usually end up seeing someone different every time you go.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

It's just uncomfortable having your body examined by a stranger. Waiting in the room, sometimes half ked, is really not my idea of fun. I am afraid of being judged by the doctor or afraid of finding out some sort of bad news about my health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had several miscarriages. I educated myself about possible causes by visiting reputable sites online so that when I saw a specialist about it, I knew what he was talking about right away when he discussed my test results.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I do feel I have the capacity to process the information,  however there are times when physicians rely on medical jargon instead of laymen terms to prove a point.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I can see through pushes some doctors make when it comes to medications and the financial benefit to them, but overall I do trust them and believe they have my best interest at heart.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The wait instills that feeling of unease; sitting there for any among of time in the doctors office makes your mind wander off into possibilities that could be highly unlikely.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had decided the Mirena was the way to go for birth control after my daughter was born. Soon after I had severe hair loss. Sure enough, when reading the fine print of the side effects associated with Mirena I see alopecia at the bottom. I requested it be removed the following week and my hair is slowly coming back.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have the capacity for this. I am comfortable with my primary care physician and his assistant enough that I would be able to ask them. If something comes up outside a visit I feel comfortable enough to call back or to do some independent research online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have only gone to my primary care physician for about a year now and hadn't had one before that for 20 years. So far he has given me no reason to distrust him and has been open to conversations about various problems. I don't have enough data to have a strong opinion on how trustworthy he is but I am assuming he is.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Something might come up. Maybe it will be caught early, or maybe something terrible will be detected like cancer.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have done research into the science of nutrition so I am knowledgeable about how to read nutrition facts. As far as other areas I don't ahve a lot of knowledge other than what my doctor has told me about me specifically. Generally my numbers are in acceptable ranges so I don't put a lot of thought into it.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I can understand most of what I am presented as far as health information.  I also feel that I can look up answers, make phone calls, ask for help, and otherwise access whatever resources I need in times that I am confused or uncertain so that I can make sure I have the knowledge that I need to make good decisions about my health and healthcare.  I have access to the internet and to people who can help me when needed.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust him to an extent, but not fully.  I believe he presents the options that are available to me honestly, but I would not trust him to make medical decisions on my behalf - in an important situation or when facing a problem I would want a second opinion, would want to do some research myself, would want to talk to other people about the situation, etc.  I also think my doctor, like many, is often more rushed for time and more concerned with getting to the next patient than I would like him to be.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I'm a pretty calm person and I don't get too nervous - but when at the doctor's for a problem I do sometimes have in the back of my head the idea that I might be really sick, or he might find a problem, or I might hear difficult news.  So I get a little uneasy and uncomfortable sometimes due to the unknown but not too bad.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When my mother was diagnosed with breast cancer a few years ago, I needed to help my parents sort through treatment options and figure out what they wanted to do as far as chemotherapy, radiation, surgery, and other treatments.  I helped them use the internet to research and to find doctors who could give them different opinions, I helped them read through the information they were given in various places, and I did my best to be supportive in their efforts to figure it all out.  I used what I knew and what I knew how to do to help them as best as I could.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. Living in the best possible health is very important to you.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have full confidence in my ability to read and comprehend medical information because English is my tive language. Aside from my fluency in English, I have been unfortute to spend a significant amount of time around doctors and hospitals because of the health of my immediate family. Therefore, I am competent when speaking with doctors and reviewing medical information.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because they are medical professiols. Since I am not knowledgeable in the field it is in my best interest not to doubt my doctor unless proven otherwise. I not denying that there aren't incompetent doctors out there, but I will give them the benefit of doubt unless evidence contradicts.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am most anxious and worried when visiting a doctor because I am fearful that they might find something seriously wrong with me. I am not a hypochondriac but I usually only see a doctor when something is bothering me.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I took care of everything when my father had a kidney transplant. This included signing up on various state donor lists, taking several semirs about dealing with someone who gets a transplant and of course speaking with the doctors and surgeons at the hospital pre transplant and post transplant.

BEEN WITH HER FOR A VERY LONG.  SHE WALKED THROUGH BREAST CANCER WITH ME AND WORKED WITH ME TO DISCOVER  THE CAUSE OF OTHER HEALTH ISSUES I WAS HAVING.  SHE LISTENS AND DOES WHAT IT TAKES TO GET HER PATIENTS WELL.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I GET MOST ANXIOUS WHEN I'M HAVING A TEST AND HAVE TO WAIT FOR THE RESULTS.  THE UNKNOWN IS NERVE-RACKING.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

WHEN I WAS DIAGNOSED WITH BREAST CANCER IN 2012 I HAD NO IDEA WHAT TO EXPECT.  I HAD NO KNOWLEDGE OF WHAT TO EXPECT FOR THE BIOPSY, THE TREATMENT, THE SURGERY, THE RECOVERY, OR THE RECONSTRUCTION. I LEARNED A LOT THROUGH THE PROCESS AND AM MUCH MORE AWARE OF MY BODY NOW.
